abstract: Passage of law forbidding discrimination against people due to sexual orientation and gender identity in Columbus, Ind, is latest example of state's municipalities enacting local anti-discrimination measures in response to religious freedom measure singed into law by Gov Mike Pence; critics of state law believe city-by-city approach is more likely to succeed than efforts focused on statewide measures.
lead_paragraph: Since the legislature passed what proponents call a religious freedom law, efforts to enact local anti-discrimination measures have spread across the state.

headline.main: Gay Rights Battle in Indiana Moves to Local Level
headline.print_headline: Gay Rights Battle in Indiana Moves to Local Level

snippet: Since the legislature passed what proponents call a religious freedom law, efforts to enact local anti-discrimination measures have spread across the state.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
